body:
```
That message only informs/warns that the response body view might take a while to show
the contents when the "Body: " view is changed to "Text" (or other view available).

Are you seeing other messages/exceptions than the one provided? Otherwise it's not
an issue.
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `THC202` on 2014-08-14 11:34:44

```
Thanks for ur response. But the links in the large response hadn't been crawled out
and the response body didn't display even I switch to Text view and no other msg showed.
I suppose ZAP doesn't crawl response with large size. Is it correct? thx.
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `vincent.xuewei` on 2014-08-16 06:30:08

```
It depends on how large the response body is. What is the size of the response body?
What type of content it has?

Would you mind checking the log file to see if there's any error? (file zap.log located
in ZAP's default directory or the directory manually specified [1]).


[1] https://code.google.com/p/zaproxy/wiki/FAQconfig
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `THC202` on 2014-08-16 07:58:04

```
the response is not large just about 260k and there's no any error log.
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `vincent.xuewei` on 2014-08-21 06:35:43

```
That's odd, that size is under the size limit (512k) of "parseable" responses.

Would you mind appending the following two lines to log4j.properties file and try spider
that page again? (the file log4j.properties is in the same directory as the file zap.log)

log4j.logger.org.zaproxy.zap.spider=debug
log4j.logger.org.zaproxy.zap.extension.spider=debug


If it's not being parsed, it should log something like:
[...] DEBUG SpiderTask - Resource fetched, but will not be parsed due to a ParseFilter
rule: http://example.com/big_page


Would be possible to provide the contents of the response?
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `THC202` on 2014-09-02 10:30:57

Faced the same issue, trying to scan https://theatres.kh.ua
The response size is 770724 bytes.
Is the parseable size limit documented anywhere? Is there any ability to increase this size?
512k seems quite a low limit.

It's not documented in the user guide (just in the code [1]), it's currently hardcoded. Guess we could remove the limit or expose an option to control it?

[1] https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/blob/8e4d34f3a1b57290ff651c5df547ce6f6ec63e29/src/org/zaproxy/zap/spider/filters/DefaultParseFilter.java#L31-L32

+1 for significantly increasing it and adding an option allowing it to be changed.
Are there any db tables that could be affected?

I don't think so (we have already a specific limit for the tables [1]).

[1] https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-core-help/wiki/HelpUiDialogsOptionsDatabase

rename.from: ZAP cannot spider/scan large response body
rename.to: Spider - Allow to configure the size limit of parseable responses

body: Issue updated, an option will be added to configure the limit and it will be increased to 2.5M.

issue.title: Allow to configure the parse response limit

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change Spider to allow to configure maximum size in bytes for a response
to be parsed.
Add tests to assert the expected behaviour of DefaultParseFilter. Also,
normalise its behaviour (null/empty handling of the HTTP message),
tweak the case of constants and other minor tweaks.

Fix #1313 - Spider - Allow to configure the size limit of parseable
responses

issue.title: Document Maximum parse size spider option

repository.name: zap-core-help
repository.description: The help files for the ZAP core

issue.body:
Change Options Spider screen page to document the spider option Maximum
parse size.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#1313 - Spider - Allow to configure the size
limit of parseable responses

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
